poem.title: H2O
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Burning like hydrogen blooming like gorse in a hollow, the burst from Aber fall-pool charges the slopes and sounds from boulders grinding and deeper than bones' resounding burden of the press and turn of water to shivers of spray in the thorn tree standing there like broken slate with a liverwort crust that gleams like galena and each thorn glancing with refracted fire.
